name: heat production, heavy fuel oil, at industrial furnace 1MW | heat, district or industrial, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/294/documentation

Inventory for the operation of an oil boiler, data related to fuel input.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

Direct air emissions from combustion, including infrastructure, fuel consumption, waste and auxiliary electricity use.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

processDocumentation.timeDescription: New data for regulated emissions like NOx, particles, other figures are partly based on older literature data.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average non-modulating, non-condensing furnace used in 2000.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Some information from other European countries has been used to determine the emission factors.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data published in literature based on measurements.

exchanges.description: Amount was scaled to 1.
